alert.note: Alert for Grainger (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:11PM CDT until May 16 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...CENTRAL GRAINGER AND WESTERN HAMBLEN COUNTIES... At 611 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Rutledge, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Jefferson City, Rutledge, Bean Station, White Pine, Panther Creek State Park, Alpha, Joppa and Buffalo Springs. This includes Interstate 81 in Tennessee between mile markers 4 and 9. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
